snippet: Protesters in several districts came under attack on Friday from men seeking to break apart their sit-ins, tearing down tents and surrounding demonstrators.
abstract: Pro-democracy demonstrations in two of Hong Kong’s most crowded shopping districts come under attack from unidentified men; protesters say attackers are pro-government gangs, and several protest groups call off planned negotiations with the government in response; both sides are showing increasing signs of wear and desperation, each improvising its next moves in the face of dwindling options.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY, AUSTIN RAMZY and EDWARD WONG
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Keith Bradsher, Alan Wong, Laurence Tan, Neil Gough and Jonah Kessel.

lead_paragraph: Protesters in several districts came under attack on Friday from men seeking to break apart their sit-ins, tearing down tents and surrounding demonstrators.

headline.main: Violence Erupts in Hong Kong as Protesters Are Assaulted
headline.print_headline: Attackers and Hostile Crowds Besiege Hong Kong Protesters
